title: Bug 21706 - BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
description:
Bug 21706 - BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage.

There is a line in the org.eclipse.swt.internal.BidiUtil class in the win32 version of SWT that uses Class.forName("org...BidiUtil"). This line causes a NoClassDefFoundError in the CLDC version of SWT, as it is not defined in the CLDC class libraries. This issue is only visible when using jxeLink or a similar tool. The Eclipse and Sun's compilers do not produce an error. To resolve this issue, the reflection in the line needs to be removed.
OB: The usage of Class.forName("org...BidiUtil") in the line causes a NoClassDefFoundError in the CLDC version of SWT.
EB:
The line should be changed to use the 'getClass()' method on a new instance of BidiUtil to avoid using reflection. This change can be made by replacing the line above with:

static Callback callback = new Callback (new BidiUtil().getClass(), "windowProc", 4);
SR: Replace the line 'static Callback callback = new Callback (BidiUtil.class, "windowProc", 4);' with 'static Callback callback = new Callback (new BidiUtil().getClass(), "windowProc", 4);'. This change should have the same effect.
